\title{Lab Report 4}


\author{Joe Opseth \& Becca Woitas}

\maketitle
\begin{minipage}[t]{1\columnwidth}%
\begin{itemize}
\item Options \& Settings for the Power Management Menu
\item Boot Options\end{itemize}
%
\end{minipage}
\begin{enumerate}
\item Computer \& External Peripheral Devices

\begin{enumerate}
\item Manufacturer \& Model Number: Dell Optiplex 760 00144352256753
\item Ports

\begin{enumerate}
\item 2 audio ports: 3.5mm mini jacks; used for speakers and microphones
\item 4 USB ports: Universal plug-and-play connector; used for mice, flash
drives, etc.
\item 1 VGA port: Video Graphics Array; used for monitors; could be used
to connect a laptop
\item 1 eSATA: Allows fast connection to external hard drives; used for
hard drives, DVD drives
\item 1 LAN: Local Area Network port (RJ-45 Ethernet socket); connects to
switches, hubs, routers
\item 1 parallel port: 25 pin port that transfers bytes simultaneously;
can be used for printers and zip drives
\item 1 display port: alternate to HDMI; connects to monitors, projectors
\item 1 DE-9 Serial RS 232: non-simultaneous data transfer; can connect
to a mouse, printer, or modem
\end{enumerate}
\item Peripheral Devices

\begin{enumerate}
\item Monitor
\item Keyboard
\item Mouse
\end{enumerate}
\end{enumerate}
\item Motherboard

\begin{enumerate}
\item Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo
\item Bus Types: 

\begin{enumerate}
\item 4 PCIE x16, 1 has network card
\item 4xDIMM memory slots, 2 attached
\item 4xSATA, 3 attached
\item 1xUSB, attached
\item 1xCPU fan, attached
\item 1xDPI Port 1 Parallel (attached to eSATA/DisplayPort/Parallel Port)
\item 1xVGA Serial (attached to VGA / 5+4 port)
\item 1xINT\_SPKR, not attached
\end{enumerate}
\item Disk Controllers: 4x SATA

\begin{enumerate}
\item SATA0 connected to 250GB Hard Drive
\item SATA1 connected to DVD-ROM
\item SATA2 connected to DVD-RW
\item SATA3 empty
\end{enumerate}
\item Main Memory: 4 slots, 2x2GB occupied
\item CMOS: PI3 PCIE 2612-BZFE 0848XG
\end{enumerate}
\item Internal Components

\begin{enumerate}
\item Hard Drives

\begin{enumerate}
\item 1x250GB SATA Western Digital 7200RPM
\end{enumerate}
\item Other Devices

\begin{enumerate}
\item 1xDVD-ROM DH-16D3S
\item 1xDVD-RW GH30N
\end{enumerate}
\end{enumerate}
\item Network Interface Card

\begin{enumerate}
\item Manufacturer: 3COM
\item Adapter: Ethernet
\item Model Number: 920-BR06
\item MAC Address: 000102690C82
\end{enumerate}
\item BIOS

\begin{enumerate}
\item Basic Information

\begin{enumerate}
\item BIOS version: A02
\item Processor Type: Intel Core 2 Duo CPU E8400
\item Processor Speed: 3.00GHz
\item Cache RAM: 6MB
\item System Memory: 4GB
\item Memory Bank 1: 2GB
\item Memory Bank 2: 2GB
\item Memory Bank 3: empty
\item Memory Bank 4: empty
\end{enumerate}
\item Does it match? This matches the information we found.
\item Expandable Categories

\begin{enumerate}
\item General: Information, Date/Time, Boot Sequence
\item Drives: Options for controlling the disk drives
\item System Configuration: Settings for the network card, USB, and other
ports
\item Video: Information on the graphics cards
\item Performance: Settings for the processor and the hard drive speed
\item Virtualization Support: Settings for virtual machine setup
\item Security: Settings for system administration and SATA passwords and
other security
\item Power Management: Settings for suspend and the fans and startup and
shutdown
\item Maintenance: Service tag, asset tag, and SERR messages
\item Image Server: Client server settings for image server
\item Post behavior: Options for the boot process, keyboard, and memory
\item System logs: A list of BIOS events
\end{enumerate}
\item Drives Configuration

\begin{enumerate}
\item SATA/IDE Devices:

\begin{enumerate}
\item SATA-0 250GB Hard Drive
\item SATA-1 DVD-ROM Drive
\item SATA-2 DVD-RW
\item SATA-3 empty
\end{enumerate}
\item Does it match? This matches what we saw inside the computer.
\end{enumerate}
\item Security Menu Options

\begin{enumerate}
\item Administrator Password: Not set
\item System password: Not set
\item Password Changes: Disabled; lets the system password be changed without
the administrator password
\item TPM Security (Trusted Platform Module): Not set
\item CPU xD Support: Enabled; execute-disable bit capability to prevent
exploitation of buffer overflows
\item Computrace: Deactivated
\item SATA-0 Password: Not set
\end{enumerate}
\item Power Management Options

\begin{enumerate}
\item AC Recovery; Power Off (when AC is restored after loss)
\item Auto On Time: 12:00 AM, Disabled
\item Low Power Mode: Disabled; saves power in shutdown or hibernate mode
(turns off integrated NIC)
\item Remote Wake Up: Enabled
\item Suspend Mode: S1 (resume more quickly from sleep, use more power)
\item Fan Control Override: Disabled; Makes fan run at full speed
\end{enumerate}
\item Boot Sequence Menu

\begin{enumerate}
\item Options

\begin{enumerate}
\item Disable devices
\item Change Device Order
\item Load Defaults
\item Exit
\end{enumerate}
\item Boot Order

\begin{enumerate}
\item Floppy Drive
\item SATA Hard Drive
\item CD-ROM Drive
\item Network Controller
\item USB Device
\item MBA UNDI
\end{enumerate}
\end{enumerate}
\end{enumerate}
\end{enumerate}
